title: Tuples
question: Which of these statements about tuples are true?
hint: Tuples are fixed in size and the types can't be changed after they are created.
correct: You can't change the types of tuple items.
You can access tuple items using numerical positions.
Tuples are created by placing items inside parentheses.
Tuples store values together in a single value.

wrong.answer: Tuples are the same as arrays.
wrong.reason: Tuples cannot grow in size like arrays can.
Tuples can hold any kind of data you want.

wrong.answer: All values in a tuple must be unique.
Tuples must always be created as variables.
wrong.reason: There's no reason tuples can't be constant.
Tuples are perfectly capable of holding multi-line strings.
Once you spend a little time with them, tuples aren't too hard to understand – honest!
